input.sentences: we saw a snow covered tree and headed toward it
we did n't realize how big it was until we got close .
next | we passed a small wood house in the middle of the woods .
as the sun came up | the snow melted off the tree .
it was almost unrecognizable as compared to before .
output.sentences: The snow had painted each tree in the yard to silvery perfection and I headed out to see what else there was to view after the winter storm.
I realize I would normally close the door, but the damp and snow gave me pause, so I placed a shovel in the doorway, to ensure I was able to get back in.
I went through the woods, behind the old house, and looked at the trees that looked so different in summer and spring, though I love them at all times.
The sun shining on the tree was lovely, even though I was very cold it was worth seeing.
I compared my winter pictures to my summer ones to prove that the trees, which seemed so unrecognizable, were the same ones I had seen in springtime.
